docs.snippet: Leo Robin, the Oscar-winning song lyricist, died of heart failure on Saturday at the Motion Picture and Television Hospital in suburban Los Angeles. He was 89 years old. Mr. Robin received nine Academy Award nominations for best song between 1934 ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Leo Robin, the Oscar-winning song lyricist, died of heart failure on Saturday at the Motion Picture and Television Hospital in suburban Los Angeles. He was 89 years old. Mr. Robin received nine Academy Award nominations for best song between 1934 and 1953.

headline.main: Leo Robin, the LyricistWho Won 1938 Oscar
